metadata.title: CVE-2017-17509 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In HDF5 1.10.1, there is an out of bounds write vulnerability in thefunction H5G__ent_decode_vec in H5Gcache.c in libhdf5.a. For example,h5dump would crash or possibly have unspecified other impact someone opensa crafted hdf5 file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17509` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hdf5-helpers - 1.10.4+repack-1
hdf5-tools - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-103 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-cpp-103 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-java - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-jni - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-mpich-103 - 1.10.4+repack-1
libhdf5-openmpi-103 - 1.10.4+repack-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hdf5 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.4+repack-1').
